awd_titl_txt: Postdoctoral Research Fellowship in Plant Biology
awd_abstract_narration: This award funds a postdoctoral research fellowship in plant                    biology for two years.  The project entitled "Molecular                         mechanisms of anti-microtubule herbicide binding to plant                       tubulin" is to be carried out in the laboratory of Dr. Louis C.                 Morejohn at University of Texas, Austin.  This represents a                     significant change in the field of research for this Fellow whose               Ph.D. training was in chemical synthesis of metal-binding                       proteins.  The focus of the postdoctoral project is the role of                 microtubules in corn and soybean.                                                                                                                               The postdoctoral fellowships in plant biology are designed to                   increase the number of outstanding young investigators in plant                 biology.
